{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2980663,"name":"","username":"anon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/47e85d/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-12-09T13:09:32.375Z","cooked":"

hello! our team is trying to use the cancoder for the mk4 swerve module.

we’ve been reading the user’s guide, and we have figured nothing about the wiring part except for the soldering part.

after soldering the wires, where do you need to connect them? do the can buses connect with the talon fxs? does the voltage wire connect directly to the vrm?

help will be greatly appreciated.
if you have a diagram or a picture of the wiring, please help us out.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2021-12-09T13:09:32.375Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1360,"reads":259,"readers_count":258,"score":6861.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":397968,"topic_slug":"how-to-wire-the-cancoder","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49891,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-wire-the-cancoder/397968/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2980670,"name":"AndrewMorrison","username":"AndrewMorrison","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a587f6/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-12-09T14:02:34.149Z","cooked":"

Hey there anon!

CTRE has some pretty good documentation on these including pictures that can be found here (https://newsite.ctr-electronics.com/content/user-manual/CANCoder%20User’s%20Guide.pdf) on page 9.

The CANL and CANH wires will connect to the rest of your CAN bus string and the 12v power and Ground you will need to supply from some place like your Power distribution panel.

Give the User’s Guide a look through, it contains a lot of good info.
Good Luck!

The CAN wires do all connect together with your Falcons the positive and negative wires from the cancoders we hooked to the VRM 500mv we have all 4 encoders hooked to 1 spot on the VRM. My research on this gave me the info that each encoder is at most 60mv so all 4 on 1 500mv shouldn’t be an issue
